text:
*ERROR with older themes (most installed in 2021)* - I don't know if this is only impacting marketplace themes or if it could impact custom themes that are using a child theme.

A soft deletion process on the HubSpot server is causing parent files (like fields.json and templates) to be deleted.

We have now had 9 customer sites go down completely, this started happening on SEP 1 and we have escalated with HubSpot to get the sites restored quicker now than the first two.

Has anyone else had an issue where the entire website goes down? The signs are that the "Theme modules" are missing in page editor ("Common modules" are at the top in the sidebar), an error that the template is missing, the content on the page editor is collapsed and missing all CSS, and/or the website doesn't load at all or parts are missing.
Hi. Is it possible that I don’t see in the contact properties who bought which Theme?

by default, the theme name is shown in the Deal Name property for Marketplace Transactions pipeline.

If you want this as a contact property, you could use a workflow to copy from the deal property to the contact using a new custom property, but I would be careful if you have multiple deals for the same, you would need multi-checkbox for the property so one download/purchase doesn't overwrite the previous.

Thank You. My idea was to send them an follow up email on some point depend the Theme. But I figured that value, like the themname, is shown nowhere in the contact properties. Do you know what I mean?

Yes, it would have to be a custom property, or you can create a list for each theme that associates the contacts with deals using that theme and then your email would go to the right people and would be customized based on the theme
The thing is, the purchase didn’t create me a deal.
Are you selling the theme in the HubSpot marketplace?
Ya, well. I give them for Free :slightly_smiling_face:
Ah, I didn't realize free themes didn't connect to the deal pipeline. Hmm...
Or it has to be activated somewhere in the setting, what I didnt check.
When the contact is created your CRM, what info does it give you? Just contact and company, or does it show the theme download in the timeline?
I can check with the marketplace product team if it is supposed to create deals for free themes
Let me share a screenshot, just a second I take the real data out.
Took it out, but still send it in PM.
